Ok here is what i'm concerned of. I don/t mind muting them but i have the tendency to defend my self at any cost and this type of stuff usually happens when i'm jg. i understand that the reason being that jg puts a lot of pressure on me and it's hard to always attend to my team mates then i get flamed if i don't and then start i start trying to defend myself then i try to mute them then my friends tell me he called me something and my mum was a something then it just frustrates me then now i get a chat restriction for trying to restrict myself from someone who doesn't even care about restricting himself like Feck im so pissed

You can defend yourself without being negative, instead of ragging on them in return, instead just explain your reasoning. If they are just a bit tilted you'll likely change their minds, even if they don't say it. If they're full toxic then there isn't anything you can do to change their minds. They have already made their assessment of you and nothing you do or say will change that, no matter how illogical that is. 

At that point it's better just to ignore them and move on. Defending yourself will only lower their opinion of you (filthy scrub needs to explain himself what a little b****) and will waste your time typing to them when you could instead be focusing on the game.

Don't get me wrong, everyone falls into the trap occasionally. I know at least once I went FULL tilt at a guy who was just the most toxic person I'd ever seen, but it doesn't make it right. 

So here is the advice I can give you. 

First of all take comfort in the fact that if they are toxic then they will face punishments same as you have, you are walking proof that the system works. If they continue to be toxic they will be banned, though you should probably take that as a warning as well.

Second is that if you feel yourself tilting, just stop. Take a few seconds, take a step away from your screen, adjust how you're sitting or whatever, just take a break and a deep breath. Let it go (as best you can), mute/ignore them and play the game to the best of your ability.

Third is to remember that this is a game, and it is about winning SECOND. First it is about having FUN. If you aren't having fun, then why are you playing? You need to take that step back and remember why you play in the first place. If it's about making satisfying plays then look for opportunities to do so. If it's about improving then look at what you are doing wrong instead of blaming negativity and toxicity. Even if you succeed somewhere, is there a way you could have done it better. 

If someone is being toxic then focus on the experience of the game rather than the experience of the people in it.

False reporting has been stated as an offence by Riot, and if a player is found to be continuously sending false reports to the system, they will be punished instead in whatever way Riot does. Full chat logs get sent to your email so it's okay that you closed the client message.
But what is "False" report and what is True how would riot know

A false report is reporting someone for an offense they didn't commit. For example if you were reported for verbal abuse but all you had said all game was "good bind" then it is a false report. (And this DOESN'T apply to the people that come to the boards and SAY they only said one thing all game because that is just never the case).

A 'true' or positive report would be something like OPs case. The system has scanned for keywords/strings, and found many things in the logs that demonstrate inappropriate behaviour, thus the report is valid and he was punished.

They investigate your previous games chat logs prior and after that game of report.

Also it takes a lot of reports for a flag to raise. It also depends on key words made in the complaint box.

You can receive a punishment from just one valid report, though usually only when you have history (not your first punishment, exceptions would be things like hate speech/death threats). They give you a bit of leeway for your first chat restriction to make sure the reports are all valid since they have no history to go off.
